edu.rit.gpu

Class GpuFloatVbl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.GpuVbl
      • edu.rit.gpu.GpuFloatVbl

  • public class GpuFloatVbl
extends GpuVbl
    Class GpuFloatVbl provides a float GPU variable. This is a variable of type float stored in the GPU's memory and mirrored in the CPU's memory. Class GpuFloatVbl provides operations for copying the variable from the CPU to the GPU or from the GPU to the CPU.

    To use a float GPU variable:

    1. Construct an instance of class GpuFloatVbl by calling the getFloatVbl() method on a Module object.

    2. Set the item field to the desired value. Call the hostToDev() method to copy the variable from CPU memory to GPU memory.

    3. Call the devToHost() method to copy the variable from GPU memory to CPU memory. Examine the value of the item field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float item
      The mirrored float variable in CPU memory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void devToHost()
      Copy this GPU variable from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
      void hostToDev()
      Copy this GPU variable from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory.
